resources.string: Agree to our Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy
Activate CopWatch when you worry there might be an altercation. This will also black out your screen and turn on do not disturb to discreetly record.
CopWatch was created to keep you safe and prove your innocence in cases of abuses of power by police.

\"Being no stranger to police violence, we have such a passion to see every power-abusing, overly violent, law-breaking law enforcement officer reprimanded or retired from duty. We believe that every person regardless of their race, religion, income or educational background or mental capacity should still be able to exercise their rights and more importantly not have their civil rights violated. There is a system in place regardless of how broken that system is. It is not in a police officer\'s scope of duties to be the jury, judge and in some cases, the executioner. We believe the only way is to record them from every angle all the time. There are over 300 million people in the United States alone. That means there are probably well over 200 million cell phones commuting across the country every day. We need to do what their badge cams were supposed to do and record every interaction with the police. It\'s time those responsible for upholding the law actually adhered to it too. \n\n-CopWatch\"
Don\'t have an account? Sign Up
Clip / body cam mode (bluetooth) \n(feature coming soon)
Dash cam / trip mode \n(feature coming soon)
My camera front and back for audio & video
Manage Phone Lock, DND, Screen Dimming
Siri, Bixby, Google Api, Interface Command
These are preferences that are put in place to enact upon startup of the app i.e. "Hey Siri, Start CopWatch" then CopWatch would open with these exact settings already in place.

In event of my death or serious injury resulting in coma or vegetative state caused by or believed to be caused by the use of place from the law of enforcement, I authorize copwatch and/or "designated person" permission to access my cloud for evidence to my benefit

In use of the free version of the copwatch where audio and/or video is admitted as an evidence in a civil lawsuit where demands are awarded as 10% of the victim or clients portion, the settlement is to be paid to copwatch app for its services to help us better our app and to cover expenses in provisions this free servicesâ€¦ you\'re welcome.
Copwatch will never in any copy will use your cloud recordings to assist law enforcement in your prosecution and has zero obligation to assist law enforcement at any time for any reason.
Please indicate that you accept our Terms and Conditions.
Password must be at least 6 characters
